Thou<S>4771</S> therefore<S>3767</S>, my<S>3450</S> son<S>5043</S>, be strong<S>1743</S> in<S>1722</S> the grace<S>5485</S> that is in<S>1722</S> Christ<S>5547</S> Jesus<S>2424</S>.
And<S>2532</S> the things<S>3739</S> that thou hast heard<S>191</S> of<S>3844</S> me<S>1700</S> among<S>1223</S> many<S>4183</S> witnesses<S>3144</S>, the same<S>5023</S> commit thou<S>3908</S> to faithful<S>4103</S> men<S>444</S>, who<S>3748</S> shall be<S>2071</S> able<S>2425</S> to teach<S>1321</S> others<S>2087</S> also<S>2532</S>. <sup>among: or, by</sup>
Thou<S>4771</S> therefore<S>3767</S> endure hardness<S>2553</S>, as<S>5613</S> a good<S>2570</S> soldier<S>4757</S> of Jesus<S>2424</S> Christ<S>5547</S>.
No man<S>3762</S> that warreth<S>4754</S> entangleth himself<S>1707</S> with the affairs<S>4230</S> of this life<S>979</S>; that<S>2443</S> he may please<S>700</S> him who hath chosen him to be a soldier<S>4758</S>.
And<S>1161</S> if<S>1437</S> a man<S>5100</S> also<S>2532</S> strive<S>118</S> for masteries, yet is he<S>4737</S> not<S>3756</S> crowned<S>4737</S>, except<S>3362</S> he strive<S>118</S> lawfully<S>3545</S>.
The husbandman<S>1092</S> that laboureth<S>2872</S> must be<S>1163</S> first<S>4413</S> partaker<S>3335</S> of the fruits<S>2590</S>. <sup>that: or, labouring first, must be partaker of the fruits</sup>
Consider<S>3539</S> what<S>3739</S> I say<S>3004</S>; and<S>1063</S> the Lord<S>2962</S> give<S>1325</S> thee<S>4671</S> understanding<S>4907</S> in<S>1722</S> all things<S>3956</S>.
Remember<S>3421</S> that Jesus<S>2424</S> Christ<S>5547</S> of<S>1537</S> the seed<S>4690</S> of David<S>1138</S> was raised<S>1453</S> from<S>1537</S> the dead<S>3498</S> according to<S>2596</S> my<S>3450</S> gospel<S>2098</S>:
Wherein<S>1722</S> <S>3739</S> I suffer trouble<S>2553</S>, as<S>5613</S> an evil doer<S>2557</S>, even unto<S>3360</S> bonds<S>1199</S>; but<S>235</S> the word<S>3056</S> of God<S>2316</S> is<S>1210</S> not<S>3756</S> bound<S>1210</S>.
Therefore<S>1223</S> <S>5124</S> I endure<S>5278</S> all things<S>3956</S> for<S>1588</S> the elect's<S>1588</S> sakes<S>1223</S>, that<S>2443</S> they<S>846</S> may<S>5177</S> also<S>2532</S> obtain<S>5177</S> the salvation<S>4991</S> which<S>3588</S> is in<S>1722</S> Christ<S>5547</S> Jesus<S>2424</S> with<S>3326</S> eternal<S>166</S> glory<S>1391</S>.
It is a faithful<S>4103</S> saying<S>3056</S>: For<S>1063</S> if<S>1487</S> we be dead with<S>4880</S> him, we shall<S>4800</S> also<S>2532</S> live with<S>4800</S> him:
If<S>1487</S> we suffer<S>5278</S>, we shall<S>4821</S> also<S>2532</S> reign with<S>4821</S> him: if<S>1487</S> we deny<S>720</S> him, he also<S>2548</S> will deny<S>720</S> us<S>2248</S>:
If<S>1487</S> we believe not<S>569</S>, yet he<S>1565</S> abideth<S>3306</S> faithful<S>4103</S>: he cannot<S>3756</S> <S>1410</S> deny<S>720</S> himself<S>1438</S>.
Of these things<S>5023</S> put them in remembrance<S>5279</S>, charging<S>1263</S> them before<S>1799</S> the Lord<S>2962</S> that they strive<S>3054</S> not<S>3361</S> about words<S>3054</S> to<S>1519</S> no<S>3762</S> profit<S>5539</S>, but to<S>1909</S> the subverting<S>2692</S> of the hearers<S>191</S>.
Study<S>4704</S> to shew<S>3936</S> thyself<S>4572</S> approved<S>1384</S> unto God<S>2316</S>, a workman<S>2040</S> that needeth not to be ashamed<S>422</S>, rightly dividing<S>3718</S> the word<S>3056</S> of truth<S>225</S>.
But<S>1161</S> shun<S>4026</S> profane<S>952</S> and vain babblings<S>2757</S>: for<S>1063</S> they will increase<S>4298</S> unto<S>1909</S> more<S>4119</S> ungodliness<S>763</S>.
And<S>2532</S> their<S>846</S> word<S>3056</S> will eat<S>2192</S> <S>3542</S> as<S>5613</S> doth a canker<S>1044</S>: of whom<S>3739</S> is<S>2076</S> Hymenaeus<S>5211</S> and<S>2532</S> Philetus<S>5372</S>; <sup>canker: or, gangrene</sup>
Who<S>3748</S> concerning<S>4012</S> the truth<S>225</S> have erred<S>795</S>, saying<S>3004</S> that the resurrection<S>386</S> is past<S>1096</S> already<S>2235</S>; and<S>2532</S> overthrow<S>396</S> the faith<S>4102</S> of some<S>5100</S>.
Nevertheless<S>3305</S> the foundation<S>2310</S> of God<S>2316</S> standeth<S>2476</S> sure<S>4731</S>, having<S>2192</S> this<S>5026</S> seal<S>4973</S>, The Lord<S>2962</S> knoweth<S>1097</S> them that are<S>5607</S> his<S>846</S>. And<S>2532</S>, Let<S>868</S> every one<S>3956</S> that nameth<S>3687</S> the name<S>3686</S> of Christ<S>5547</S> depart<S>868</S> from<S>575</S> iniquity<S>93</S>. <sup>sure: or, steady</sup>
But<S>1161</S> in<S>1722</S> a great<S>3173</S> house<S>3614</S> there are<S>2076</S> not<S>3756</S> only<S>3440</S> vessels<S>4632</S> of gold<S>5552</S> and<S>2532</S> of silver<S>693</S>, but<S>235</S> also<S>2532</S> of wood<S>3585</S> and<S>2532</S> of earth<S>3749</S>; and<S>2532</S> some<S>3739</S> <S>3303</S> to<S>1519</S> honour<S>5092</S>, and<S>1161</S> some<S>3739</S> to<S>1519</S> dishonour<S>819</S>.
If<S>1437</S> a man<S>5100</S> therefore<S>3767</S> purge<S>1571</S> himself<S>1438</S> from<S>575</S> these<S>5130</S>, he shall be<S>2071</S> a vessel<S>4632</S> unto<S>1519</S> honour<S>5092</S>, sanctified<S>37</S>, and<S>2532</S> meet<S>2173</S> for the master's use<S>1203</S>, and prepared<S>2090</S> unto<S>1519</S> every<S>3956</S> good<S>18</S> work<S>2041</S>.
Flee<S>5343</S> also<S>1161</S> youthful<S>3512</S> lusts<S>1939</S>: but<S>1161</S> follow<S>1377</S> righteousness<S>1343</S>, faith<S>4102</S>, charity<S>26</S>, peace<S>1515</S>, with<S>3326</S> them that call on<S>1941</S> the Lord<S>2962</S> out of<S>1537</S> a pure<S>2513</S> heart<S>2588</S>.
But<S>1161</S> foolish<S>3474</S> and<S>2532</S> unlearned<S>521</S> questions<S>2214</S> avoid<S>3868</S>, knowing<S>1492</S> that<S>3754</S> they do gender<S>1080</S> strifes<S>3163</S>.
And<S>1161</S> the servant<S>1401</S> of the Lord<S>2962</S> must<S>1163</S> not<S>3756</S> strive<S>3164</S>; but<S>235</S> be<S>1511</S> gentle<S>2261</S> unto<S>4314</S> all<S>3956</S> men, apt to teach<S>1317</S>, patient<S>420</S>, <sup>patient: or, forbearing</sup>
In<S>1722</S> meekness<S>4236</S> instructing<S>3811</S> those that oppose themselves<S>475</S>; if<S>3379</S> God<S>2316</S> peradventure<S>3379</S> will give<S>1325</S> them<S>846</S> repentance<S>3341</S> to<S>1519</S> the acknowledging<S>1922</S> of the truth<S>225</S>;
And<S>2532</S> that they may recover themselves<S>366</S> out of<S>1537</S> the snare<S>3803</S> of the devil<S>1228</S>, who are taken captive<S>2221</S> by<S>5259</S> him<S>846</S> at<S>1519</S> his<S>1565</S> will<S>2307</S>. <sup>recover: Gr. awake</sup> <sup>taken: Gr. taken alive</sup>
